modName: How to Have an Epic Skyrim- guide and mod list
summary: In brief, a list of mods that I personally couldn\'t play Skyrim without, as well as an easy-to-follow guide on how to put them in your game.
descriptionHtml:
HOW TO HAVE AN EPIC SKYRIM: 
A GUIDE


Skyrim is, in every sense of the word, an awesome game. However, shortly after its release, people decided that improvements could be made, and they made them. This guide is designed for people who are rather new to modding Skyrim. Perhaps you’ve modded a previous TES game, but not Skyrim yet. Or maybe your game had failed you and is totally unplayable. You’re ready to give up and completely start over. Maybe you wonder what mods out of tens of thousands, you should use.   I’ve tried to make the instructions as detailed and simple to understand as possible. Also is a list of the mods I use in my game, which make Skyrim perfect for me. I tend to play female characters, so if you don’t care for fashionable clothing and armor, this one might not be for you.

A word to the wise: Before starting all this, blast your favorite music and have a cup of coffee (or two or six) and a snack. This whole process of cleaning things up, installing things, and tidying things up again WILL take a while. As I was writing this guide, and later following it, it took me from 2 AM until 6 AM. But I promise you, it’s worth it in the end.

Let us proceed, shall we?

Step 0: (If you already have Skyrim with a bunch of mods installed)
Open the Nexus Mod Manager and Deactivate all your Mods
Go to C:\\program files (x86)\\steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim and delete everything there.
Go to C:\\Games\\Nexus Mod Manager\\Skyrim\\Mods and delete everything that you see there, too.
Uninstall your Nexus Mod Manager. 
Using Steam, uninstall Skyrim. Go to your Steam Library, right click your Skyrim game, and click delete local files.
Then go to /My Documents/My Games and delete the Skyrim folder if there is one.
There’s one last file. It is hidden and you\'ll find it in C:Users>Username>AppData>Local> Skyrim and contains three lists: DLCList.txt, plugins.txt and SteamModList.txt. Given the fact that you have uninstalled everything, mods included, you can delete them too.

Step 1:
 Redownload Skyrim using steam.
Run the game. Exit the game once you get to the opening screen with the New Game, Load, and Credits buttons on it.
Step 2: 
Install the Nexus Mod Manager
